project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Energy Efficiency Project for Poland is to increase public and private sector investments in energy efficiency in buildings. The project has disbursed US$10.4 million out of the US$11 million Global Environmental Facility (GEF) grant and is well underway to reach its objectives. The reallocation is necessary to: (i) reallocate US$200,000 intended for the National Registry activity from the Technical Assistance (TA) category of expenditure to the goods category since the main part of the activity will be purchase of software, and (ii) reallocate remaining unused funds to the Thermo-Modernization (TM) Investment Component in order to fund additional TM investments.
